definition[0]: used to show that the man or boy who does something is affected by his own action
example[0]: In despair, the young boy had hanged himself.
example[1]: His name is James but he calls himself Jim.
example[2]: He poured himself a glass of orange juice.
definition[1]: used after words such as ‘everyone’, ‘anyone’, and ‘someone’ to talk about people in general being affected by their own actions
example[3]: Everyone should learn to respect himself.
definition[2]: used to emphasize that you are talking about one particular man or boy
example[4]: It was the president himself who opened the door.
example[5]: It must be true – he said so himself.
example[6]: The other passengers were all refugees like himself.
